title: Quiz: Controlling Axes, Ticks, Labels, Legends

questions.text: Which Matplotlib method is used to set the title of an Axes object `ax`?
questions.explanation: `ax.set_title()` is the correct method to set the title for an individual Axes object.

questions.text: To display a legend in a Matplotlib plot, you only need to call `ax.legend()` without providing `label` arguments in your plotting commands.
questions.explanation: For `ax.legend()` to work effectively, you need to provide the `label` argument in your plotting commands (e.g., `ax.plot(x, y, label='My Data')`).

options.text: Sets the number of x-axis ticks to 10.
Sets the range of the x-axis from 0 to 10.
Limits the plot to the first 10 data points on the x-axis.

questions.explanation: `ax.set_xlim(left, right)` sets the visible range (limits) of the x-axis.
